page.title: 12EDUCATION IN 1985
page.content: Education for children in this area began in the 1930's with schools at Northchapel and Roundhurst. In the 1920's Roundhurst School amalgamated with Lurgashall School.In September 1949 Lurgashall and Ebernoe Schools amalgamated with Northchapel all age school.In September 1950 this school became Northchapel County Primary School and children over the age of 11 attended Midhurst Grammar School or Midhurst Secondary Modern School. In 1978 schools in this area were again re-organised into a 3-tier system of education.Northchapel School became a first school for children from 5-10 years. Many children have long distances to travel to school and the West Sussex County Council has to provide transport for those who live more than 1.5 miles away from school.
